description: A 60-second lesson on How Solar Panels Work.

hook.text: A solar panel has no moving parts, no fuel, and no noise. It just sits in the sun and makes power.

discovery.text: Photons knock electrons loose from silicon atoms, creating an electric current.

punchline.text: Sunlight hits silicon. Electrons move. That's solar power.
